4. The vacuum adiabatic body of claim 2, wherein a diameter of the bar at the second end is less than a diameter of the bar at the first end.

5. The vacuum adiabatic body of claim 2, wherein the bar is shaped such that a cross-sectional area of the bar gradually decreases along the bar in a direction from the first end of the bar and towards the second end of the bar.
6. The vacuum adiabatic body of claim 2, wherein the bar includes an outer wall defining a hollow portion, andwherein the outer wall includes the first end and the second end.

7. The vacuum adiabatic body of claim 6, wherein the outer wall of the bar includes a slant surface configured to extend obliquely from the first end and toward the second end with respect to the second direction.
8. The vacuum adiabatic body of claim 2, wherein a cross-section of the bar has a triangle shape including a side defined by the first end and an apex defined by the second end.

9. The vacuum adiabatic body of claim 2, wherein a cross-section of the bar has a trapezoid shape or rectangular shape, which includes a first side defined by the first end and a second side defined by the second end.

10. The vacuum adiabatic body of claim 1, wherein the bar includes:an outer wall extending from the support plate, a diameter of the outer wall decreasing in a direction away from the support plate;an extension extending from an end of the outer wall and having a diameter greater than the diameter of the outer wall at the end; anda stepped portion provided between the outer wall and the extension.
11. The vacuum adiabatic body of claim 1, further comprising a sheet provided between the first plate and second plate, the sheet being positioned adjacent to the first plate.

12. The vacuum adiabatic body of claim 11, wherein the sheet includes a bar insertion hole through which the bar is inserted, andwherein the bar includes a slant surface configured to extend obliquely with respect to the second direction, the slant surface contacting the sheet at the bar insertion hole.
13. The vacuum adiabatic body of claim 11, wherein the sheet includes a first sheet having an insertion slit, and a second sheet having an insertion region coupled to the insertion slit.

14. The vacuum adiabatic body of claim 11, wherein the sheet includes a first sheet having an insertion region defined by a cut-out vertex, and a second sheet having an edge to which the insertion region is coupled.

15. The vacuum adiabatic body of claim 11, further comprising a spacer provided between the sheet and one of the first plate or the second plate,wherein the spacer includes a column having a through hole in which the bar is inserted and a plurality of legs that extend from the column and are configured to support the sheet.

16. A vacuum adiabatic body, comprising:a first plate;a second plate, a vacuum space being provided between the first plate and the second plate;a sheet provided between the first plate and second plate, the sheet being positioned adjacent to the first plate;a support plate provided in the vacuum space and extending in a first direction;a bar provided in the vacuum space and extending in a second direction; anda spacer provided between the sheet and the second plate, the spacer being coupled to the bar.
17. The vacuum adiabatic body of claim 16, wherein the spacer includes a column having an inner surface configured to support the bar and an outer surface configured to support the sheet.

18. The vacuum adiabatic body of claim 16, wherein the bar includes a slant surface supported by the inner surface of the column, the slant surface of the bar extending obliquely with respect to the second direction.
19. The vacuum adiabatic body of claim 16, wherein the sheet includes a hole, andwherein the bar and the spacer are configured to be inserted into the hole of the sheet.

20. A vacuum adiabatic body, comprising:a first plate;a second plate, a vacuum space being provided between the first plate and the second plate;at least two sheets provided between the first plate and second plate, the at least two sheets being positioned closer to the first plate than to the second plate; anda bar extending in a first direction in the vacuum space, the bar being configured to pass through one of at least two sheets,wherein the at least two sheets include a first sheet having an insertion slit and a second sheet having an insertion region received in the insertion slit of the first sheet.
